Building people’s capacities  
To effectively adopt improved health behaviours, people need skills in planning 
and practicing as well as develop skills in coping and recovering, if they fail to continue. These can be best done through a small practice session using small 
group (10-15) efforts to build a supportive environment and a deeper sense of 
community feeling. After the demonstration, the group can break down into still smaller groups, each having 8–10 members for practice sessions. The activities organized for them must be fun, socially and culturally appropriate, and more
